title: Clean & Beautiful Interior
text: Stayed just a night at Essence Hanoi before heading to Sapa and Halong Bay after - hotel staff were friendly and rooms were all intricately designed; and they look exactly like the photos posted online.

title: Deliciousness even in delivery
text: Been in-store for their ice-cream and decided to do a delivery for their mains. Love the Vongole Linguine, and I'm quite amazed how their chicken wings were still crisp in every bite despite the long distance delivery from the cafe to my place. Also ordered their Tom Yum Thin Crust Pizza and cream mushroom soups - both were flavourful and very appetising in general. Would definitely love to dine in here once the circuit breaker measures are lifted in Singapore.

title: Great Hospitality As Always
text: Had a great flight with Singapore Airlines from Singapore to Tokyo. Still love the hot towels provided each time we come on board, and the in-flight entertainment was updated with a wide range of movies and TV shows. We were hungry in the midst of the flight (even after inflight meal was served) and the air stewardess gave us a variety of cookies as snacks to fill our tummy. She even asked if we would like to opt for a cup noodle, which we were quite surprised. Very hospitable, definitely looking forward to flying again with Singapore Airlines when travel is back to normal again.

title: Skewers Paradise
text: This is a paradise for all swekers lovers. Mostly prepared by the kitchen and cooked beforehand, the tray box is literally just for keeping thr skewers warm. Most skewers will be seasoned with their signature mala powder, if you don't wish to this spice you may opt out (just got to tell the staff). Visited this place with non-local friends and they love it too. Cheap and tasty! Definitely recommend any to try the potatoes, oyster mushrooms, toast bread and lamb skewers!

title: Cute 3D Latte Art
text: Came here cos we're around Changi area, hanging around before heading to Pulau Ubin. You've got to mention to the staff that you'd like a 3D foam art (if not they'd assume you won't) and it's applicable only to ice lattes. Rather pricey for the drink but you've got to give it for the barrista's craftsmanship. Hot latte also came in a flat 2D cute design. There's free Wi-Fi available too. Overall, a good cafe experience.

title: Tasty but Pricey
text: Bearable queue and waiting, took about 30 min in total before we got to enjoy the burgers. Got two burgers and a portion of their cheese fries. Definitely tasty but not sure if it was worth the price to revisit often as a fast-food option. Probably best recommended to dine in rather than taking out.

title: Super Good Value for Money
text:
A fast-food chain for Indian cuisine
Had their set meal that was super filling. Comes with briyani rice, naan and two sides of your choice. Portions was so generous that it can feed 2 pax. Definitely worth to drop by if you're craving for Indian cuisine when you're visiting the airport.

title: Decent food with great service
text: Came here for a birthday celebration. It was rather quiet for a Friday night but it has a good ambiance. Great hospitality was great, and staff were knowledgeable to give recommendations though prices are on the steeper end.

title: Good for Quick Meal
text: Went to the Vivo City basement branch. Ordered the chicken rice that is just S$4.80 each, its simple and fuss free. Portion might be small to some but it's just enough for us. A decent variety of vegetables available, we ordered sambal kangkong and it was tasty and not too spicy. Enjoyed their fluffy prawn omelette too, though kinda pricey (S$9) for it's size. Overall meal experience was good for a quick meal.

title: AMAZING Coconut Shake
text: Went to the branch at Jewel Changi Airport basement. Was told that their coconut shake is a must-try so we chose the Coconut Avocado Shake with 0% sugar, and we added a scoop of coconut ice-cream. It was THE BEST shake we've had. Cos we chose 0%, I was surprised the shake still turned out super delicious! The natural sweetness of the coconut is sweet enough, and we love the coconut bites on every sip we had. Hands down, a must-try! Great for hot days especially.

title: Great Service, Good Views,Decent Food
text: Came here for dinner on a Friday evening. Service was great with really friendly staff. Food was decent, ordered an aglio olio with roasted pork belly and mini burgers. Won't say it's fantastic but they're good. Options for vegetarian/vegan for several mains/pastas/sides. There's also good views from the seats facing the waterfsll vortex. Overall a great dining ambiance.

title: Easier to find a sit here than ION Orchard
text: Somehow the turnover of tables is quicker here than that of ION Orchard branch. Would always be able to find a table for two here rather quickly. The toast set meal is great, I like to go with Set A- half boiled eggs, a small coffee/tea and 2 slices of traditional toast with kaya butter. You may change the filling to butter sugar or even peanut butter. Simple and fuss free meal, quick to serve too.

title: Beautiful Murals
text: Just within 5min walking distance from Chinatown MRT (Exit A), Temple Street (just beside the Buddha Tooth Relic Temple) has amazing wall murals that will capture your attention even from afar. Definitely great for anyone who likes to know a little more about the country and the local Chinese culture with some visuals. Great for photography as well.

title: Tasty, Decent Portion but Pricey Nasi Lemak
text: I won't say this is the best nasi lemak I've had because I definitely had better ones in Singapore that are half the price of what The Coconut Club charges. No doubt their chicken leg portions are great, love the chilli but for the price, I won't necessarily come back again unless I've got a friend in town who wants to try it. They're quite strict on the queue too, so make sure all your friends turn up and queue altogether since they'd only alloe you to enter when everyone turns up.

title: Budget Steak Fix
text: If you're looking for a budget option for a decent good Western meal fix, you can't go too wrong with Astons. With several branches across the sunny island, every Astons we'd been to have been pretty consistent. Personally love their classic chargrilled chicken steak with garden veggies & potato wedges are sides. Definitely recommend!

title: Great Central Shopping
text: Located walking distances across several local attractions including the national library, Bugis Junction is a huge mall (especially when you combine with Bugis+) that has several food options. Definitely a great mall with several restaurants and cafes to choose from to enjoy the indoor air conditioning if it is too hot outdoors.

title: Affordable & Surprisingly Good
text: Came in not expecting much cos we just wanted to try a new dim sum place aside from the usual Swee Choon. Service was quite fast, and food turned out to be surprisingly good. We especially love the cripsy shrimp rice roll, and the unique baked version of salted egg yolk bun. Prices are affordable, and we definitely see ourselves coming back again for another weekend dim sum brunch.

title: Hidden Gem in Golden Mile Tower
text: A friend brought us here for drinks and we honestly felt quite dubious initially cos of the location. But it turned out to be an absolute surprise! Service is slow but our host Xiaoyu was extremely friendly and apologetic. The food was also amazing, with very well prepared Japanese snacks. We enjoyed the fried chicken skin, fried sakura prawns, and cucumber and wasabi octopus salad. They also offered a sake tasting beforr we bought and we had 2.5 litres of sake to drink in total. Price came up to $230, a steal for what we had.

title: Great for Dumpling Cravings!
text: Came here with colleagues for lunch whenever any one of us is craving for good Chinese dumplings. It's great value for money here as portions are quite generous. There's a wide variety of Chinese food, and we highly recommend trying either the steam or fried dumplings when you're here!

title: Love the Butter Chicken
text: Second time back here for dinner and we ordered Butter Chicken, Fish Tikka Masala, Garlic and Butter Naans. Really filling, decent portions for two. Love the Ice Limau too, definitely more economical to order the jug than individual drinks if there's 2-3 of you.

title: Spectacular Sunset Views
text: We planned our trip to visit just before sunset and we were so glad we did! It was an amazing view from the top, overseeing the beaches and surrounding skyscrapers. Definitely worthed the visit!

title: Amazing Gin, Fruitful Distillery Tour
text: Had the privilege to get a sneak peak of Husk Distillers even before they opened to the public in June last year. Our guide Mauricio gave us an introduction to their liquor-making operations and made us samples of their liquor cocktails. The most stunning of their liquors was their unique (blue pea) Ink Gin product. Love the great outdoor space they had right in front of the Distillery. Certainly worth dropping by if you're in the region!

title: Homely Italian Restaurant
text: Amazing Italian restaurant tucked away in this small town of Tweed, NSW. Our hosts at the EcOasis Resort brought us here to have dinner and it was the most lovely dinner with locals we'd had on our Australia trip. Every dish was delicious, and there's even an art gallery on the second floor that is complimentary for viewing!

title: Surprisingly Refreshing
text: Came here for their famous strawberry watermelon cake and I wasn't expecting much because I personally don't like fruits in cakes. However, it was surprisingly refreshing and the ingredients really complemented well with each other. We were lucky to get a window seat in the cafe that is probably only big enough to fit three couples.

title: Simple, Tasty & Fuss-Free
text: Came here for lunch with a friend on a weekday lunch peak (1230) but we were assigned a table relatively quickly. Had their char siew and fried dough rice rolls and both were simple, tasty and filling! Prices are affordable as well. Definitely coming back again~

title: Affordable Hotel in Kings Cross
text: Located in a relatively good location, walking distances to several good coffee/brunch places - the Springfield Lodge was a decent hotel stay for its price. Not exactly spacious, and the toilet was relatively small.. it was at least cheap for the price we booked it for.

title: Hidden Gem Near Gold Coast
text: Nestled in the lush forests area of Tweed Heads, just 40min drive from Gold Coast Airport is this amazing resort. EcOasis Resort blew us away, with the luxurious interior and an unobstructed view of My Warning and the setting sun. Love the seclusion we have from the typical crowd, and this two-storey private villa was just beyond our expectations. Shout out to lovely homeowners Peter and Karissa for their amazing hospitality! If you're looking for a unqiue and tranquil accommodation experience, this is definitely a great place for your holiday!

title: Good Heartland Mall in Jurong
text: One thing that stands out in this mall would be the variety of food/restaurants you can find in here. Connected to both an air conditioned bus interchange and Boon Lay MRT Station, this is a large heartland mall that can satisfy all your necessities (banks, post office, supermarket, etc) in one place.

title: Good Local Vibes
text: Just like any other SEAsian night market, it was a good way to enjoy the country like a local and have a taste of their local street food. A good bazaar to get cheap souvenirs for friends/family back home.

title: Very BLUE indeed
text: After the White Temple, we made our way to the Blue Temple since they're both a must-see when you're in Chiang Rai. Intricate designs and hand paintings everywhere, even in the ceilings of the temple. Certainly awe-inspiring

title: Old clock tower in the middle of the road
text: Wasn't really a significant point of interest I'd say. It's located in the middle of a busy cross road junction, good to just snap a photo of it. Otherwise, it just looks pretty much like another tall tower in the day.

title: Not your typical temple
text: Grabbed here first thing in the morning from our hotel and found that several other tourists had the same thought to avoid the usual tourist crowd by coming earlier. Came in a sleeveless long dress but was told that I must cover my shoulders before I could enter. Had to rent a scarf at a shop just outside that exit and all was good. Definitely not your typical worship temple but there is a monk seated inside (hence the stricter dress code). Ridiculous intricate designs of the sculptures here, and we even found some gold temple at the end that you could also enter.

title: Spectacular Night Scenes
text: If there is a definite must-visit place in Singapore whenever friends come to visit, I'd always bring them to Gardens by the Bay at night. The domes are better to visit in the day to avoid the heat and get natural lightning, but the super trees ought to be visited at night. There are two night light/music shows every day in the evening at 745pm & 845pm. This is a definite must-see when you're here. I've been here more than 5 times at different months and never once was I bored with the magical lights. Spectacular indeed!

title: Delicious Peranakan Food
text: Had friends in town and we decided to bring them for a Peranakan feast. Gorgeous interior of the restaurant, and every dish was made to perfection. Highly recommend the beef rendang and kueh pie ties among all the delicious dishes we had!

title: Magnificent Indoor Gardens
text: Came here with family to spend the weekend afternoon. Every corner was almost Instagram-Worthy. The ropewalk was kinda scary at first, definitely recommend wearing proper shoes (not flats or sandals). Overall a very good afternoon spent in the comfort of an air conditioned environment.

title: Last bit of Japan before Departure
text: Spent our last 4,000JPY at this sushi restaurant and it was worthed every cent we paid for. Fresh and amazing variety of sushi available. We took the bar counter seats and could watch the chefs working in harmony as they prepared our dishes. Definitely recommending to anyone departing or transiting in Narita Terminal 1!

title: Loveee their Kimchi Cheese Pancake
text: Came here with a Korean friend who is a big lover of their Kimchi Cheese Pancake. When a local tell you their pancake is good, you trust that it's seriously authentic. Love how their pancake is always crispy on the outside and not overly doughy like how other Korean restaurants might tend to do theirs. Tried their other Korean dishes but they were quite mediocre. Definitely recommend trying the Kimchi Cheese Pancake if you're here!
place: Wang Dae Bak Korean Bbq Restaurant

title: Good Breakfast Fix
text: Always a great place to satisfy my prata cravings. It's best dining in since prata are always made fresh and crisp. Love the fish curry, it's just enough spice and it's free to refill if you ever need a second curry serving!

title: Set Meal Deals
text: Came here to dine with family and their set meals were pretty decently - pork ribs soup, a bowl of rice, youtiao and soy beancurd dessert. Find them often less crowded than the other famous franchise, good for a quick meal if you aren't too fussy about the quality.

title: Amazing Weekend Staycation
text: The hotel was having a great promotion for Crystal Club Lounge access and we booked a room for staycation not expecting much. The hospitality from every staff in Grand Park City Hall was amazing. Special shout out to Thomas at the Crystal Club Lounge who was great attention to details and offered great recommendations on food and drinks. Love his passion he had put in to serving every guest in the lounge. We were really grateful to be upgraded to a pool-facing room with bath tub. This is a smart hotel where we can simply control in-room facilities (lightings, etc) via the mobile app. The most convenient way was to unlock with the room key via the same app, no need to worry about carrying or losing the room keys anymore! Location was superb, walking distance to City Hall MRT. Definitely recommend anyone visiting Singapore, or locals who are looking for a staycation.

title: BEST Nasi Lemak in Singapore
text: Came to the branch at The Capitol (Cityhall) and ordered Set B (with two chicken wings). For the price $6.90 and 1x Otah add-on for $1.90, it was worth every cent for this tasty nasi lemak. Chicken wings were crispy, egg yolk burst perfectly as you poked it, every single item on the plate was mind blowing good. Definitely recommending to anyone craving for a good nasi lemak in town.

title: Decent Affordable Sushi with Good Variety
text: Came here as the fiancé is a big fan of Chojiro Restaurant back in Kyoto and he was excited to know there is a franchise now in Singapore. Love the good variety of sushi available as compared to the other franchise sushi restaurants in Singapore. Prices were relatively affordable and overall, we had a great meal. Will certainly come back again.

title: Simple & Delicious
text: Came here for lunch with colleagues since we're craving for something light and soupy. Had a bowl of comforting slice beef pho and ordered spring rolls (fresh & fried) for sharing. Overall a simple, delicious homely Vietnamese meal.

title: BEST Tteokbokki Stew in Singapore
text: Can't emphasise how much I love this tteokbokki place when I was first introduced by a Korean colleague. Reminds me of 먹쉬돈나 (mokshidonna) in Seoul. Since then, I've brought both Korean friends and Singaporeans who love tteokbokki to this restaurant. Good for sharing among 3-4pax. Recommend to go for original spicy level for the most authentic taste. Definitely order the fried rice after you're done with the main stew. If it's too much to finish, you can always ask for a take out for the fried rice. Highly recommended to anyone who is looking for good Korean food in Singapore.

title: Be prepared to sweat buckets!
text: Came here with friends for a weekend lunch as we were craving for some mala grilled fish. Knowing how spicy Sichuan food can get, we chose the least spicy option and we were mind blown when the dish arrived. It obviously looked alot spicier than we had expected ha. Nonetheless, it was a good meal though tat bit salty.

title: Instagram-Worthy & Delicious
text: Came here for a Christmas gathering with my girls and we were definitely wow-ed by the extravagance of the high tea set. Don't be deceived by the term 'hightea' because it was extremely filling and delicious. We honestly didn't expect to be so full! Great service too by the staff at Anti:dote.

title: Good Local Food Buffet
text: Came here for lunch on a weekend, it's located in Hotel Rendezvous itself. Good spread of local food, especially the crayfish and the durian desserts!

title: Still the Best Chili Crab
text: Nothing beats JUMBO's signature chili crab. Love the peanuty, spicy and tat sweetness of the chili crab sauce. Definitely order the fried buns that complement with the chili crab. A definite must have in JUMBO. Next must-have is their signature tofu topped with Seaweed and crab meat. If there's more than two of you to share, order the amazing coffee pork ribs as well.

title: Decent Food
text: Mainly came here because a friend was in town and wanted to try chicken rice and Wee Nam Kee in Marina Square is the only option that is air conditioned in a mall, in CBD. Not the best service but food was decent, can't go too wrong with chicken rice of a supposed reputable restaurant chain.
place: Wee Nam Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice Restaurant

title: Pet-Friendly, Pretty Interior
text: Came here for brunch friends as we had a puppy with us and Botany allows is a pet-friendly cafe. Food was decent, and the interior of the restaurant is pretty. Came back a second time with anther group of friends in just 1 month.

title: Great Views, Food & Drinks
text: Came to F.O.C Sentosa as our company held our event here. Canapes were amazingly delicious, and cocktails were good. Caught an amazing sunset view from the second floor, certainly coming back again for drinks next time.

title: Authentic Greek Cuisine
text: Was looking for a local restaurant to wrap up our trip to Greece and chanced upon Ta Karamanlidika. We were lucky that we came in slightly before the peak dinner time, hence we were given a seat right away. Since the menu was entirely in Greek, we asked for recommendations by the staff. We enjoyed every single dish, including the complimentary dessert. A great local cuisine experience!

title: Great Location & Service
text: Location of the hotel was great, it's walking distance to food and sightseeing attractions. Room and toilet were spacious and clean. The hotel also arranged an airport transfer for us to head back to the airport after a two nights stay. Recommend to anyone visiting Athens!

title: Only Convent in Meteora
text: Smaller in scale as compared to our first monastery visit at Varlaam. Good views from the small deck, and there are significantly lesser steps to climb as compared to the rest. Definitely good for people who can't too much climb stairs. Beautiful little garden courtyards at the back of the church too.

title: James Bond Filming Location
text: Apparently a filming location for the famous James Bond movie, we didn't go into the monastery since it is one of the most difficult to reach but our tour guide (Key Tours) stopped by to allow us to capture its magnificent view from the opposite.

title: Beautiful Spacious Monastery
text: The first monastery we visited in Meteora and we were one of the first tour groups to arrive. Do take note of strict dress codes to all monasteries in Meteora. Long skirts and sleeved tops/dresses are required to enter. Females in jeans/slacks and males in berms are required were all given a skirt (free rental) to wrap over before you can enter. Do bring your own scarf or dress appropriately if you do not wish to risk not being able to enter during peak seasons.

title: Average for 1 Night Stay
text: Hotel was arranged by Key Tours as part of our 2D1N Delphi Meteora Tour. It was decent for just 1 night, don't expect too much and you'd be good. Food was OK. Hotel is located walking distances to shops in Kalambaka Town, and we could see some monasteries afar from the outside.

title: Part of the Delphi Archaeological Site
text: It's part of the entrance into the Delphi Archaeological Site. Walk further up and you'd find the ruins of the Temple of Apollo. Go further up to capture both the top view of the ruins and the beautiful views of the mountains in the background.

title: Delphi-nitely Worth It
text: Came here as the first pit stop of our 2D1N Delphi Meteora Tour. Sun was scorching hot, there aren't any shelters since its the ruins of an archaeological site. So please prep your hat, sunshades, water and sunscreen cream in advance if you're visiting in summer. Love the guide's impeccable knowledge on the history of the site. Great views of the site from the top if you make a short hike up.

title: Scenic Boat Ride
text: Was looking for an activity to do in Santorini and our hotel staff recommended going on a Volcano boat tour. Definitely a great way to go around different islands. Departed from the old port of Fira, you can choose to walk down like we did (or you can choose to take the poor horses, or take the cableway from the top). There is also a small hike at the first volcano pit stop. Good to wear proper shoes. 3 hour was just sufficient for the tour. We didn't bother to jump into the 'hotspring' water cos we've read reviews on how it's not that fantastic. We did not regret to choose to stay onboard. Overall a good experience and recommended for anyone finding activities to do in Santorini.

title: Decent Restaurant by the Jetty
text: Had an hour stopover at Thirassia Island during our Oia Santorini Volcano Tour and we honestly weren't sure which restaurant to enter. Randomly walked into this cos the rest looked tat bit too intimidating cos obviously they all serve mainly tourists from the boat tours. Food was OK, decent. Enjoyed the good views and breeze.

title: Good to see with Temple of Olympian Zeus
text: Passed by this mighty arch while we are on the way to Temple of Olympian Zeus. Located just the temples, certainly great to visit here in the evening for a stroll and watch the beautiful sunset behind the arch.

title: Rich History, Well-Preserved Architecture
text: If you're keen in understanding more on the history of Athens, this is a great Greek temple that is very well-preserved and mainly intact. Worth a visit here when you're in Athens.

title: Great Free Views from the Outside
text: Read reviews on how there isn't quite a need to enter because you can see it perfectly from the outside. When we arrived, we couldn't agree it more.

title: Lovely Local Restaurant
text: Love the interior of this restaurant, it's spacious and well-ventilated during the hot summer season. Really affordable local food (love the fish!) and generous portions. It was the only restaurant that remain open throughout the April public holiday, so we came back twice (lunch & dinner). Highly recommended to anyone visiting Athens.

title: Great Sunset Views & Ambiance
text: My fiancé made a reservation a couple weeks prior to our trip in order to get a good seat of the sunset view. We had probably the best seat, and the seafood we ordered were fresh & delicious! The friendliness of every staff was beyond what we had expected. Certainly a great meal with great ambiance!

title: Cheap & Good Pita Wraps
text: Can't get enough of this pita wraps, even their kebabs are good! Portions are quite value for money. It was a short wait when we arrive but it didn't take that long. Recommended to anyone who wish to have an affordable meal on this touristy Oia island.

title: Cheap & Good Snack
text: Dropped by here to grab an afternoon snack while escaping from the outdoor heat. We came in without much expectations cos it felt almost like a fast food place but we were pleasantly surprised! Good for anyone who just wish to have a quick bite in the middle of the day.

title: BEST Sunset View in Santorini!
text: Was recommended this restaurant by our hotel staff since it's just a 5-min walk. We were hesitant at first as we thought why should we have Mexican food when we came all the way to Greece. Nonetheless, we went ahead and boy we did not regret! Despite having no reservations, we were lucky that we got the best sea-facing seat ever for that spectacular sunset view. Food portions here were generous, and the homemade sangria was probably the best I've ever had! Felt almost like a hidden gem and we were so glad we came. Skip that crowded touristy Oia sunset and visit here instead!

title: Great Food & Most Passionate Owner
text: Was intrigued by this restaurant cos most reviews mentioned about the owner Irene. We decided to make a booking at this restaurant in downtown Fira and we were so glad we did! It was possibly the most homely dinner we had in Santorini. Food was amazing and Irene explained to us every dish, how her husband goes to the market early to get the freshest ingredients. To our surprise, she even gave every guests a complimentary dessert. Love Irene's passion and enthusiasm with both her restaurant and her guests. Definitely recommend!

title: Immersive History Lesson
text: Backpacks are not allowed, hence it'd have to be checked at the side counter. A good place to hide from the scorching hot sun, it is recommended to visit here in the afternoon (when it's the hottest outside). Learnt great lessons on the history of Greece, especially the new outdoor excavation exhibition located in the basement. The excavation was probably the most amazing exhibits, there is even a video documenting the process of this excavation. Highly recommended!

title: Marvelling Cultural Experience
text: Definitely a must-see when you're in Athens! Felt like a travel back in time when you are immersed in the scenes of the ruins. One mistake we made was to visit in the late morning when sun was scorching hot in the peak of Summer. We bought the tickets over the counter but it's best to buy them online in advance.

title: Clean, Affordable & Amazing Hospitality
text: Most hotels in downtown Fira or even Oia are not only expensive but you may end up paying so much with tourists peeping into yr hotel. Located just 2-3min away from downtown Fira, the hotel offers free shuttle to/fro downtown that you can easily request anytime. Love the architecture, the amazing breakfast spread, the pool with complimentary big float, and most importantly, the friendliness of the hotel staff. There is a Mexican restaurant recommended by the staff, which is just 5min walk from the hotel and it has the best sunset views we've seen while in Santorini. Definitely recommended to anyone visiting Santorini!

title: Small portions for the price
text: Decent taste, similar to back in Korea but the portions are just alot smaller than what you'll in Korea. Still happy to come here if I miss having dakgalbi (spicy stir-fry chicken). Definitely recommending having the fried rice after, its the best part of such Korean meals.

title: Go-to Place for Coffee & Brunch
text: Great place for decently good coffee. Love their fancy Jawa / Okinawa coffee as well though we always asked for a less sweet version. Among all the brunch menu, fish tacos are our go to must-have. The tacos and curly fries are super crisp and not oily. Love it!

title: Okay Ramen
text: Pop by for an early dinner so there wasn't any queue. Ordered the signature Kotteri(?) ramen but the broth was too thick and salty for my liking. My fiancé ordered the Tonkatsu Mix Ramen and the broth I'd say is better. Wet towels are charged separately, though water is complimentary when asked.

title: Great Chirashi Don with Generous Servings
text: Came here on a Friday night for dinner and there's a queue (no surprise). Known for their generous thick slices of sashimi in their chirashi don, they didn't disappoint as expected. Tried their soft shell crab maki hand roll and it's amazing for it's price. Definitely worth the short queue if you're done for some good sushi/sashimi in Singapore!

title: Amazing Views from Rooftop Bar
text: Went for after work drinks with colleagues. Decent service and your usual cocktail prices in Singapore. What blew my mind was the view of CBD (and that other rooftop bar from across)! Felt like a tourist in my own country when I discovered this place.

title: Great Ambience & Lunch Set Menu
text: Came here for team lunch and the lunch menu set (offered in two-course or three-course) was pretty worth it's price. Ambience was great, service was good and food was excellent. Had their desserts and coffee, overall a great experience. Definitely recommend for anyone looking for a good ambience for business meeting in CBD area. It's right outside one of the exits at Raffles Place MRT.

title: Great for takeaways
text: Ordered the Mushroom Melts and a Pulled Pork sandwich. Love the mushroom melts though both sandwiches were tat bit oily for myself. Portions were generous. Coffee was good. Not quite a place for you to sit down long for chats since it's mostly bar tools in the small cafe. I'd say it's great for takeaways instead.
